summary: This bill, the "340B Affording Care for Communities and Ensuring a Strong Safety-net Act" (340B ACCESS Act), proposes significant reforms to the 340B drug pricing program. It defines patient eligibility, specifies requirements for hospital child sites and contract pharmacies, mandates patient affordability measures, and introduces data reporting and transparency requirements for covered entities. The bill also addresses Medicaid duplicate discounts, sets standards for administrator and contract pharmacy fees, and clarifies the program's intent to support underserved communities. Furthermore, it prohibits discrimination against covered entities and pharmacies participating in 340B.
